intro: Plukenetia penninervia, commonly known as the African butterfruit, is a tropical shrub native to West Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule containing oily seeds, which are used to extract a yellow dye and have historical significance in traditional dyeing practices. The plant thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and disturbed areas.
